title: PRESS DIGEST - Bulgaria - Oct 16
text:
SOFIA, Oct 16 (Reuters) - These are some of the main stories in Bulgarian newspapers on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

-- Acting on the instructions of Prime Minister Boyko Borissov, Bulgaria´s Foreign Minister Ekaterina Zaharieva held a phone conversation with British ambassador Emma Hopkins, the Foreign Ministry said, adding that all measures were taken by the Bulgarian side immediately to resolve the case with the racist incidents during the soccer match between Bulgaria and England on Monday (24 Chasa, Trud, Monitor, Sega)

-- After a meeting of the country's security council, Bulgaria urged its southeastern neighbor Turkey to suspend military operation in northern Syria, saying the risk of a humanitarian crisis is very high (Sega, Trud, 24 Chasa)

-- Herro Mustafa, the United States ambassador-designate to Bulgaria, was sworn in at a ceremony at the State Department in Washington DC
